title: Example C# algorithms have no-longer-called OnData(TradeBars), OnData(Dividends), etc.
body:
Commit d24f665ee4c38289907782409c1d210e3d259882 removed the
Engine/AlgorithmManager.cs support for OnData(TradeBars), making these methods
dead code.  Hence, some of these algorithms stopped placing orders.  In all of
them, the algorithm is a better example with the method written to get called.

<!--- This template provides sections for bugs and features. Please delete any irrelevant sections before submitting -->

#### Expected Behavior

https://github.com/QuantConnect/Lean/blob/master/Algorithm.CSharp/BasicTemplateFillForwardAlgorithm.cs
places at least one order.

#### Actual Behavior

No orders: https://www.quantconnect.com/terminal/processCache?request=embedded_backtest_a764a3cee8766f1fc166ab2142fb529b.html

#### Potential Solution

s/TradeBars/Slice/ fixes that: https://www.quantconnect.com/terminal/processCache?request=embedded_backtest_143fa389801acb939d85be8f0c316f10.html

#### Reproducing the Problem

Copy
https://github.com/QuantConnect/Lean/blob/master/Algorithm.CSharp/BasicTemplateFillForwardAlgorithm.cs
into a workspace, then run a backtest.

#### System Information

QuantConnect cloud environment
